instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hey guys,

history:

3 ports were showing 5V/0.45A
1 port was dead / burn mark on chip / nothing on amp-meter

changed the chip. now the 3 working ports showing 5V/0.25 -> dead port showing now 5V/0A

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> / 3v3 are there, when i connect to the working ports. strange voltages when i connect to the "faulty" port...

bad chip or what to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.3v on working ports -> t2 crap?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
You should get same behavior on all ports.
Compare diode mode readings and voltages around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
everything looks okay. just read about the board on repair.wiki.

i put a new <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> on it - i really need to pull the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> from a donor board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Only 01700 is known for weird issues with <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.
01949 should accept new chip (if good).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
okay, whats going on here...

put another chip on it. on this chip the amp meter shuts off and on in a loop. on the same side the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> gives me 5v 0.26a

on the other side i get on both chips 20.4v - jumping to 0.3a and then to 0.02a...whats happening here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
You still have problems on that side; <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip, bad solders, or surrounding components.
You may try reflashing corresponding TBT ROM chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
okay, i think its like bad soldering.

put another new one on it. on the good side its booting up now, got an apple and login screen.

on the bad side same behaviour...

i thought every <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> should be good to boot up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power / changed <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Good enough if T2 can talk with all <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.
If a problem exists on the "front side" of <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips, that can cause this symptom.
